tn.text: AT: "These are the names"
"in different ways" or "in many ways"
"Each group"
four thousand men** - "24,000 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
AT: "all year long."

This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of March and the first part April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"the leader"

This is the second month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of April and the first part of May on Western calendars. (See: tA topic Hebrew Months and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"In his military group" or "In his group of soldiers"
four thousand men** - "24,000 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

This is the third month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of May and the first part of June on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ch:11:10|11:11]].

tn.ref: The commander for the fourth month was Asahel brother of Joab
tn.text: "Asahel, brother of Joab, was the commander for the fourth month."

This is the fourth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of June and the first part of July on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"his military group"
four thousand men** - "24,000 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

This is the fifth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of July and the first part of August on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

This is the sixth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of August and the first part of September on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This is the name of a place.

tn.ref: The commander for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, from the people of Ephraim
tn.text: "Helez, the Pelonite, from the people of Ephraim, was the commander for the seventh month."

This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of September and the first part of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of tribes or clans. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
four thousand men** - "24,000 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

This is the eighth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of October and the first part of November on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

This is the ninth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part November and the first part December on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of places. It is during the last part December and the first part January on Western calendars.
four thousand men** - "24,000 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

This is the eleventh month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of January and the first part of February on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

This is the twelfth and last month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of February and the first part of March on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: those twenty years old or younger
tn.text: "people 20 years old or younger," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"increase the population of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The number of the people of Israel is compared to the number of stars to show that there were so many. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
AT: "God punished the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: This number was not written down
tn.text: AT: "No one wrote this number down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"responsible for guarding"
"strong towers."
This means to dig into or break up the dirt before planting.
This is the name of a place.
These are the parts of a building that are below the ground and used to store wine.
This is a type of tree. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of places.
"that ate grass in the fields" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of tribes or clans. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"These men"
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a tribe of clan.
